prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 1
Name: Ernest Amano
Description: Benefactor when I studied in Germany. Director of the Amano Group.
Character 2
Name: Lance Amano
Description: Son of Ernest Amano. Victim of the kidnapping. I knew him when he was a child.
Character 3
Name: Kay Faraday
Description: Self-purported Great Thief. She suddenly appeared, but why was she stalking me?
Character 4
Name: Shi-Long Lang
Description: An Interpol Agent. He is in charge of this kidnapping case for some odd reason.
Character 5
Name: Shih-na
Description: Lang's trusty secretary. Level-headed, she supports him in his investigations.
Character 6
Name: Oliver Deacon
Description: Amano family butler, and Lance's private tutor. Could not be contacted recently.
Character 7
Name: Mike Meekins
Description: Precinct police officer. Was conducting investigation while in Blue Badger costume.
Character 8
Name: Lauren Paups
Description: Lance Amano's girlfriend. Came to Gatewater Land in search of Lance.
Character 9
Name: Ema Skye
Description: High schooler in Europe to become forensic scientist. On school break.
Character 10
Name: Security Lady
Description: The lady inside the Pink Badger. I believe her real name is Wendy Oldbag.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Prosecutor's Badge
Description: Proof of my profession. However, I prefer to keep it in my pocket.
Evidence 1
Name: Gatewater Land Pamphlet
Description: Map and explanation of park attractions listed.
Evidence 2
Name: Bad Badger's Head
Description: Costumes separate into head and body. This head was left in the Isolation Room.
Evidence 3
Name: Blue Badger Bible
Description: Book detailing info on the whole Badger family.
Evidence 4
Name: Badger Photo Rally
Description: There's only 1 of each Badger in the park. Try to get the whole Badger family!
Evidence 5
Name: Stolen Costumes
Description: The kidnappers stole three costumes: a Blue, a Proto and a Bad Badger. Blue Badger = Lauren Paups Proto Badger = Lance Amano Bad Badger = Oliver Deacon
Evidence 6
Name: Preliminary Findings → Mr. Deacon's Murder Notes
Description: Victim: Oliver Deacon. Seems he was shot dead. Victim, Deacon, shot from ABD through shoulder. Body was moved. Shot from ABD through shoulder.
Evidence 7
Name: Mr. Deacon's Pendant
Description: It's shaped like a horse. "Colin Devorae" is engraved on the back.
Evidence 8
Name: Blue Badgermobile
Description: Mobile shop on three wheels. Was parked inside Wild, Wild West area garage.
Evidence 9
Name: Victim's Costume
Description: He was likely wearing one due to the footprints' shape and the lack of blood. Worn at the time of the shooting. Gunpowder burn is proof he was shot from point blank.
Evidence 10
Name: Love Letter
Description: Letter for Lance Amano. The sender is the "Tender Lender Loan Company".
Evidence 11
Name: Colin Devorae Dossier
Description: Details Oliver Deacon's real name and history. [info]Caolin Devorae
Sex: Male
Dominant Hand: Right
Height: 5'8"
Weight: 123.45 lbs

Whereabouts unknown after his escape from Penn E. Dent Prison. Stole a gun from a guard during his scape. We thought he might head for where his wife and sole daughter are, but despite our surveillance, he has yet to show up.
Evidence 12
Name: Broken Prop Sword
Description: Was used to jam the handle to the hideout's door from the inside. Culprit hit me in the right temple area with this.
Evidence 13
Name: Missing Model Gun
Description: Was ripped from the Bad Badger costume. It's capable of firing blanks.
Evidence 14
Name: Ms. Paups's Pendant
Description: It's shaped like a pair of wings. "Lauren D." is engraved on the back.
Evidence 15
Name: Revolver
Description: Used to kill Deacon. Was originally stolen from guard by victim during escape.
Evidence 16
Name: Mirror Fragments
Description: These were found inside the victim's costume. Why were they there in the first place? Different from the mirrors on the walls. Very thick and has a design on the back.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I'll grant you that the two of them are father and daughter.
Person: Lang
Testimony 1
Testimony: But, isn't it possible that they both knew that fact?
Person: Lang
Testimony 2
Testimony: It was no coincidence that the reunited pair became involved in the house of Amano.
Person: Lang
Testimony 3
Testimony: And the two of them made good use of their meetings to plan this little kidnapping.
Person: Lang
Testimony 4
Testimony: Wouldn't you say my scenario is perfectly probable as well?
Person: Lang

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Lang's Testimony 3 claims that "the two of them made good use of their meetings to plan this little kidnapping," which implies both Lauren Paups and Oliver Deacon worked together and planned the kidnapping as a team.

However, Evidence 2 (Bad Badger's Head) and the investigation findings specify that this Bad Badger's Head was left in the Isolation Room. Furthermore, the list in Evidence 5 (Stolen Costumes) and other context suggest that Oliver Deacon was the Bad Badger and Lauren Paups was the Blue Badger, meaning that while involved in the chain of events, the nature of their involvement might not have been as co-conspirators.

The more direct contradiction is found between Testimony 3 and Evidence 16 (Mirror Fragments). The Mirror Fragments were found inside Oliver Deacon's costume—the Bad Badger. These were not part of a plan, but evidence of a struggle or incident involving Deacon, suggesting he may have been a victim or caught off guard, instead of an active planner working willingly with Lauren Paups. This makes a planned cooperative kidnapping implausible.

Therefore, the evidence (Mirror Fragments in Deacon's costume) contradicts Lang's testimony that they worked together as co-conspirators.

Lance: They must've used some drug to knock me out. Because before I knew it, I was off in La-La Land again. When I woke up, I was in the kidnappers' hideout already, all tied up.

Person: Lance
Testimony 1

Testimony 2

Person: Lance
Testimony 3
Testimony: My hands were cuffed, but it was a stroke of luck that they left me alone.
Person: Lance
Testimony 4
Testimony: I made my escape and ran away from that room as fast as I could.

cot:
Let's look for contradictions:

Testimony 3 (Lance): "My hands were cuffed, but it was a stroke of luck that they left me alone."
Evidence 12 (Broken Prop Sword): "Was used to jam the handle to the hideout's door from the inside. Culprit hit me in the right temple area with this."

If Lance's hands were cuffed, how could he have used a prop sword to jam the hideout's door from the inside, as the evidence suggests? This suggests a contradiction: he shouldn't have been able to manipulate the prop sword if his hands were cuffed.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: That man was not my father! I mean... Because... at the stadium...
Person: Paups
Testimony 1
Testimony: ...there was a Bad Badger pulling the suitcase with the $1 million in it.
Person: Paups
Testimony 2
Testimony: But that Badger pointed the gun in his left hand at me, aiming to shoot me dead!
Person: Paups
Testimony 3
Testimony: That's why I... I used the gun I got from Lance...!
Person: Paups
Testimony 4

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Testimony 3 states: "That's why I... I used the gun I got from Lance...!" (implying Lauren Paups shot someone with a gun she got from Lance Amano). However, Evidence 2 (Bad Badger's Head) is simply a costume part and does not contradict the testimony. 

A better contradiction is between Testimony 2: "But that Badger pointed the gun in his left hand at me, aiming to shoot me dead!" and Evidence 11: Colin Devorae Dossier, which states Oliver Deacon (the Bad Badger at the time) is right-handed, suggesting he would naturally use his right hand to point a gun, not his left. Thus, the testimony contradicts the dossier evidence.

Testimony 0

Person: Lance
Testimony 1

Person: Lance

Person: Lance
Testimony 3
Testimony: So Mr. Edgeworth, even you must see that Lolli was only acting in self-defense.

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot: Lance's Testimony 3 states that the act was committed in self-defense, implying the shooter was facing an immediate threat from Oliver Deacon. However, Evidence 9 (Victim's Costume) indicates that Oliver Deacon was shot at point blank while wearing a costume, and crucially, he was shot through the shoulder from behind (as also stated in Evidence 6), which makes a self-defense scenario—typically involving a face-to-face confrontation—highly implausible. Therefore, the claim of self-defense is contradicted by the forensic evidence about the manner and direction of the shot.
